div.p:
BY vertue of this Writ I took two pots brazen, two skillets brazen, &c. of the goods and Chattels of I.S. in this Writ named in Withernam, and tho≈øe to W.B. to be delivered I have cau≈øed, to be had to the ≈øame W.B. untill the afore≈øaid I.B. the bea≈øts of the afore≈øaid W.B. deliver will, as this Writ wills and requires: and further to you I
certifie, that the afore≈øaid I.H. in this Writ named no other goods has, nor chattels which in Withernam taken may be ‚Ä¢ or by which be attached he may according to the tenor of this Writ.

div.head: Return of the Writ of Collect of the 15. and 10. out of the Exchequer.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ to me directed, to know I have cau≈øed to the within named A.B. And al≈øo tho ≈øe things which of the part of the Ke pers of the Liberties of Englandare to be done, I have given in command to the ≈øaid A.B.concerning the levying and collection of the ≈øixt Quiri≈øme and Di≈øme o ‚Ä¢ ≈øix whole Quiri ≈ømes and Di≈ømes within written, and an Obligation according to the form of the ≈øtatute within written to the afore≈øaid A.B. to be ≈øhown have cau≈øed, by him of the part of the ≈øaid Keepers to bee ≈ø ealed, and as his Deed to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid Keepers to be delivered, viz. I gave in command: but the ‚Ä¢ ore≈øaid A.B. altogether it to ≈øeale, or about the collection afore≈øaid to intermeddle, refu≈øed, and yet refu≈øes, in contempt of the ≈øaid Keepers, therefore the ≈øaid Obligation at the day and place within contained have I cannot, as within to me is commanded. And therefore I certifie that to know I have cau≈øed to the within named C. D. that he about the levying and collection of he ≈øaid ≈øixth Quiri≈ømie and Di≈øme of the ‚Ä¢ fore≈øaid ≈øix whole Quirizmes and Di≈ømes within written diligently doe intend, and an obligation according to the form o ‚Ä¢ the Statute within written from the ≈øame C.D. have I received, and the ≈øame in the Exchequer, &c. at the day within contained I certifie, as within to me is commanded.

div.head: The return of a Wood writ in the Exchequer.
div.p: TO the Barons within written I certifie, that P.M. L.S.& T.W. in the ≈øcedule to this Writ annexed, named no goods have, or Chattels, Lands or Tenements within my Shire, whence the ≈øeverall debts upon them, and every of them impo≈øed levy I may, but by vertue of this Writ to me directed, I have levied of the goods and Chattels of H.L.T.K. and I.B. in the ≈øaid ≈ø cedule named, the ≈øeverall ≈øummes upon them and every of them charged, and tho≈øe monies before the Barons within written, at the day and place within contained ready I have, as within to me is commanded. And further I certifie, that I.B. E.A. and W.B. in the ≈øaid ≈øcedule named, have alledged, that they have wherewith to exonerate the actions for the ≈ø evrall ≈øummes upon them and every of them charged, and for this have I taken of them ≈ø ufficient ≈øurety and have prefixed them a day of being here at the Exchequer, within written at the day and place within contained as within to me is commanded.

div.head: Return of the Writ of Re≈øpit of Homageoth Di≈øtringas in the Exchequer.
div.p:
M. of the within named A.B.
I. Doo.
Rich. Roo.
I≈ø≈øues‚Äîxx. s. Or according to the value of the Land more or le≈ø≈øe.

div.head: Return of Sei≈øure in the Exchequer in name of di≈øtre≈øs.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ to me directed the twentieth day of M. the year, &c. within written fifteenth, into the hands of the Keepers of the Liberties of England, &c. the mannor of S. within written, with the appurtenances in S. in the County afore≈øaid, which Mannor is of the clear yearly value in all i≈ø ≈øues over and above the repri≈øes of twenty pounds of the Land of P.B. in the ≈øcedule to this Writ annexed named, I have taken al≈øo into the hands of the ≈øaid Keepers one gun called a Petronel, with the Flax and touch box of the value of ten ≈øhillings, in name of di≈øtre≈øs of the goods and Chattels. of I.C. in the ≈ø cedule afore≈øaid, named as this Writ wills and requires, &c.

div.head: Otherwi≈øe where Nihil is returned.
div.p: TO the Barons within written I certifie, that A.B C.D.and the other per≈øons in certain ≈øcedules to this Writ annexed named, no goods have or Chattels within my Shire, whence the ≈øeveral debts upon them charged, or any parcel thence levie I may, nor are they found, nor of them is any found in my Shire, nor are there any Executors of the Te≈øtament, or la≈øt Will of the afore≈øaid ≈øeveral per≈øons, nor admini≈øtrators of the goods and Chattels which theirs were, nor any Heirs or Tenants of Lands of the afore≈øaid ≈øeveral per≈øons or of any of them within my Shire which I might di≈øtrain, as that Writ wills and requires.
The re≈ø idue of the Execution of this Writ appears in a certain Inqui≈øition to this Writ annexed.

div.head: Nihil return.
div.p: South.AN Inqui≈øition by Indenture, &c. who ≈øay on their Oath that A.B.C.D. &c. in the ≈ø cedule to this Writ annexed named, ≈øeveral dayes and years in which fir≈øt debtors they became to the Keepers of the Liberties of England, &c. or at any time ≈øince to this time, no goods had or Chattels, Lands or Tenements within my Shire, which extended or apprized might be within their knowledge, And that dead they are but what day and year, or dayes and years, and where, altogether they are ignorant of, In Te≈øtimonie of which, &c. as above.

div.head: Where the Land extendable lies in another County.
div.p: TO the Barons within written I certifie, that all the Lands and Tenements which were to the within named N.F. or to any of his ance≈øtors lie in the County of S. and no; in my Shire.

div.head: Commorant in another County.
div.p: The within named E.S. is Sher. of the County of O. and is Commorant in the ≈øaid County of O. and is not found in my Shire.

div.head: Return for the Sheriff him≈ø elf.
div.p: TO the Barons within written I certifie, that I H.W.Knight, now am Sher. of the County of S. therefore my ≈øelf di≈øtrain I cannot, as within to me is commanded.

div.head: Return of the Writ for election of Kn. for the Parliament.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ to me directed, to be cho≈øen I have cau ≈øed, two Knights with Swords girt, the mo≈øt fit and di≈øcreet of my County afore≈øaid, viz. W.F. and I.S. which Knights full and ≈øufficient power for them≈øelves and the Commonalty of the County afore≈øaid, have, to do and con≈øent to tho≈øe things which at the day and place within contained of the Common Coun≈øel, &c. of England, to be ordained ≈øhall happen, And the afore≈øaid W.F. and I.S. mainpri≈øed are by I.P.W.B.R.D.and R N. to be at the Parliament, &c. at We≈øtmin≈øterat the day within contained, to do as that Writ ≈øhall exact and require, I have made al≈øo a precept to I.P. and W.S. Bailies of the Liberty of the town of G. that of the Burrough of G. to be cho ≈øen they cau≈øe two Burge≈ø≈øes of the mo≈øt di≈øcreet and mo≈øt ≈ø ufficient, that they may be at the Parliament, &c. at the day within contained, to do and con≈øent as afore≈øaid. Which Bailies ≈øo to me an≈øwered, that to be cho≈øen they have cau≈øed of the afore≈øaid Burrough of G. two Burge≈ø≈øes, di≈øcreet, and the mo≈øt ≈øufficient to be at the Parliament afore≈øaid, viz. S.W. and R.W.
The re ≈øidue of the execution of this Writ appears in a certain Inqui≈øition to this Writ annexed.

div.head: Return of the Writ to receive the order of Knighthood.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ to me directed, as well within the Liberty as without, through my whole Shire publickly to be proclaimed have I cau≈øed, that all and ≈ø ingular per≈øons, having Lands, Tenements, or Rents, as within written is, who≈øe names in a certain ≈ø cedule to this Writ annexed are written, to the pre≈øence of the Keepers of the Liberties of England, about the Fea≈øt within written, per≈ø onally do appear and come; the afore≈øaid Order to receive, as within to me is commanded.

div.head: Return of Re≈øcuous.

argument.p: The Execution of this Writ appears in a certain ≈øcedule to this Writ annexed.

div.p:
BY vertue of this Writ of the Keepers of the Liberties of England, &c. to medirected, and to this ≈ø cedule anuexed, have I made a certain my Warrant, to a certain I.M. my Baily itinerant, to take and arre≈øt E.G. in the ≈øaid Writ named, which my Baily by vertue of my Warrant afore≈øaid, the tenth day of I. the year, &c. at D. in the County of S.afore ≈øaid, took and arre≈øted the body of the afore≈øaid E.G. and then and there, him E.G. in his cu≈øtody had, upon which F G. of C.afore≈øaid, in the County afore≈øaid gent. and T.M. of the ≈øame town and County, gent. then and there by force and Armes, viz. with Swords, Ponyards, and Staves, upon my afore≈øaid Baily a≈ø ≈øault made, and him my afore≈øaid Baily then and there, again≈øt the Law and Cu≈ø tome of, &c. England, &c. and again≈øt the will of him my Baily impri≈ø oned, and him my Baily in pri≈øon, there by the ≈ø pace of one howe then and there held, and twenty pence in monies numerate of the goods and
Chattels and pence of him my Baily, from the per≈ø on of him my Baily then and there, the afore≈øaid T.M. took, and the afore≈øaid E. by force and Armes afore≈øaid, then and there out of the Cu≈øtody of my ≈ø aid Baily took and re≈øcued, And al≈ø o the ≈øame E. him≈øelf then and there out of the cu≈øtody of my afore≈øaid Baily re≈ø cued, again≈øt the will of the ≈øame my Baily, and again ≈øt the peace publick, and after the ≈øame E. was not found in my Shire.

div.head: Otherwi≈øe by the Baily of the Hundred.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ have I made a certain my Warrant to W.H. Baily of the Hundred of H. who thus me an≈øwered, that where he by vertue of the Warrant afore≈øaid, the tenth day of S. the year, &c. at C. in the County afore≈øaid, took a certain I.S. and him to the Gaol of the Keepers of the Liberties of England, &c. of the Ca≈øtle of Winch. would have brought ≈øafely to be kept, thither came a certain I.G. and R.S. with many others unknown, by force and Armes, in manner Warlike arrayed, and from the cu≈øtody of the ≈øaid Baily at, &c. the afore≈ø aid I.S. took and carried away, and the ≈øaid Baily would have killed, unle≈øs the ≈øame S. to e≈øcape he had permitted, and ≈øo becau≈øe of fear of his death, him I.S. to e≈øcape he permitted, And ≈øo that cau≈øe the body of the ≈øaid I.S. before the Keepers of the Liberties of England, in the upper Bench, &c. at the day and place within contained have I cannot as within to me is commanded. And further I certifie that the afore≈øaid tenth day, &c. the afore≈ø aid I.S. was not found in my Shire.

div.head: Otherwi ≈øe by the Baily of the Liberty.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ to me directed, I have commanded I.S. the Baily of the Liberty of D. in the County afore≈øaid, who has full return of all Writs, Precepts, Warrants, to him thence directed, And who ≈øuch day and year at P.in the County afore≈ø aid, T.S. in the Writ to this ≈øcedule annexed named took, and arre≈øted, and him T.S. in his cu≈øtody by occa ≈øion afore≈øaid then and there had and held, And a certain I.C. lately of S. in the County afore≈øaid Husbandman, gathering to him many other Malefactors unknown, of the peace of the Commonwealth troublers, to the number of twenty per≈øons, in manner warlike arraied, by force and Armes, viz. &c. upon him the Baily then and there riotou≈øly a≈ø≈ø ault made, and him beat, wounded, and evil intreated, ≈øo that his life was de ≈ø paired, And that I.C. and the others, &c. him T.S. out of the Cu≈øtody of the ≈øaid Bailie then and there took and re≈ø cued, and as he li≈øted at large to goe permitted, again≈øt the will of the afore ≈øaid Baily, And the ≈øame T.S. him≈øelf out of the cu ≈øtody of the ≈øaid Baily then and there in like manner re≈øcued again≈øt the peace publick, &c. and after the ≈øame T. was not found in my Shire.

div.head: Return of a Proclamation out of the Chancery.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ to me directed publickly to be proclaimed have I cau≈øed, within my Shire, that the within named H. under the pain of his ingagement before the Keepers of the Liberties of England, &c. in the Chancery within written, at the day within contained appear, as within to me is commanded, al≈øo to the Keepers of the Liberties afore≈øaid I certifie, that the with in named H.B is not found in my Shire.

div.head: Return of the Commi≈ø ≈øion of Rebellion.
div.p: TO the Keepers of the Liberties of England,&c. I certifie, that the time of the receit of this Commi≈ø ≈øion, to me and others directed, the within named W.W. taken and arre≈øted was by W.S. Knight, Sheriff of the County of S. by vertue of divers Wri ‚Ä¢ s to the ≈øame Sheriff directed, and to the Gaol of the ≈øaid Keepers of the Ca≈øtle of Winch. by the ≈øame Sheriff committed was, in which Gaol I the afore≈øaid I.W. the afore≈øaid W.W. by vertue of this Commi≈ø≈øion him to be attached have cau ≈ø ed, as within to me is commanded, but his body at the day and place within contained, have I cannot, becau≈øe the ≈øame W. in the ≈øame Gaol, under ≈øafe cu≈øtody of the ≈øaid Sher. for diver≈øe other cau≈øes there is detained.

div.head: The return of a Dedimus pote≈øtatem to take the Oath of a Sheriff.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ to us directed ≈øuch day and year, &c. within written, we haue received the Oath of the within named R.O. Sher. of the County of S. that office well and faithfully to perform, according to the form of a certain ≈øcedule to the≈øe pre≈øents annexed, as within to us is commanded, and as this Writ exacts and requires.

div.head: Return of a Writ of Premunire.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ ≈øuch day and year by I.S. T.W. and I.F. good and legall men of my Shire, to forewarn have I c ‚Ä¢ u≈øed W.K.Clerk within named, that he be before the Keepers of the Liberties of England, &c. at the day and place where≈ø oever, &c. to do and receive as this Writ ≈øhall exact and require, and I.B.and the re≈ø t of the De≈øendants within named, nothing have in my Shire, by which them forewarned make I may, no ‚Ä¢ are they found in it.

div.head: Return of the Writ where a Clerk has no lay Fee.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ to me directed, to the Ju≈øtices within written I certifie, that the within named T.H. Clerk, is beneficed in the Bi≈øhoprick of London, having no lay Fee in my Shire where he may be ≈øummoned.

div.head: Return of the Writ of Election of a Verdour of a Forre≈øt.
div.p: TO the Keepers of the Liberties of England I certifie, that the within named I.H. before the comming of this Writ to me directed dead was, and that I after the receit of this Writ, in my full County held at the Ca≈øtle of Winch. in my County, the twenty ninth day of March, the year within written, by a≈ø≈øent of the ≈ø ame County in the place afore≈øaid I. to be cho≈øen have cau≈øed, a certain N.S. E≈øq. Verdour of the Forre≈øt of B. within written, to do all tho≈øe things which to that office belong, as this Writ exacts and requires.

div.head: Return of the Writ of Summons before the Ju≈øtices of the Forre≈øt.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ to me directed, to be ≈øummoned have I cau≈øed the Arch Bi≈øhops, Bi≈øhops, Earls, Barous, and all other free-holders who Lands and Tenements have within the metes of the Forre≈øt of the Commonwealth within written, and four men and the chief of every town within the metes of the ≈øame Forre≈øt, And al≈øo two good and lawfull men of every Burrough within the metes of the ≈øaid Forre≈øt, bound to come as they ought and were wont, that they be before the Ju≈øtices within written, at the day and place within contained, as within to me is commanded, publickly al≈øo to be proclaimed have I cau≈øed through my whole Shire, as well in Burroughes as in other Towns, and in Faires, Markets, and other places publick, that all tho≈øe who by Charter of the Keepers of the Liberties of England now, or of their Ance≈øtors or Progenitors, or any other manner any Liberties or Franchi≈øes hold, or Liberties to have claim, And by what Warrant, That they be before the ≈øaid Ju≈øtices at the day & place afore≈øaid, To be proclaimed al≈øo have I cau≈øed, that all men attached for Vert and Veni≈øon in the Forre ≈øt afore≈øaid, after the la≈ø t plea of the Forre≈øt afore≈øaid held, and their pledges and mainpernours, who have day by mainpri≈øe afore≈øaid, to be before the afore≈øaid Ju≈ø tices, to ≈øtand to the right, and to do tho≈øe things which according to Law of Forre≈øt do they ought.
The re≈øidue of the Execution of this Writ appears in a certain Panel to this Writ annexed.

div.head: The Panel.
div.p: Anthon. B. of C. gent. and ≈øo twenty four for the grand Jurie, and twelve for the petty Jurie.

div.head: When any man ≈øhews the Sheriff his Tallies
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ to me directed, to the Barons within written I certifie, that the Fermors within named, after the receit, to me have ≈øhown their Tallies of payment of their Ferm within ≈øpecified, For which I have prefixed them a day to be before the Barons within written, to do and receive upon their Tallies afore≈øaid, according to the tenor of this Writ, And therefore the levying of the ≈øum within ≈øpecified, I ≈øuper≈ø. as within to me is commanded.

div.head: Return of the Writ to proclaim the Sheriff to render his account by the Coroners.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ to us directed, to the Barons within written we certifie, that in the full County of S. within written, held at the Ca≈øtle of Winche≈øter in the County of S.afore≈øaid, the twentieth day of A.the year, &c. within written, And al≈øo in the full County afore≈øaid at W. afore≈øaid, the eighteenth day of September, the year, &c. as al≈ø o diver≈øe times after in the County afore≈øaid, articulately to be proclaimed have we cau≈øed, all and ≈øingular the Articles which in this Writ are contained and ≈øpecified, as by this Writ to us within is commanded.

div.head: Return of Capias out of the Exchequer, as well of the body as of the Land in name of di≈ø tre≈øs.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ to me directed, to the Barons within written I certifie, that I have taken the body of the within written I.R. who≈øe body before the ≈øaid Barons ready I have, at the day and place within contained, al≈øo the twentieth day of I. the year, &c. within written, I have taken into the hands of the Keepers of the Liberties of England, &c. in name of Di≈øtre ≈øs, certain Lands and Tenements of the within named I.R. lying and being inB. of the yearly value of C. s. as this Writ exacts and requires.

div.head: Capias in to our hand a Manner.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ to me directed, to the Barons within written I certifie, that the twentieth day of March the year, &c. within written, I have taken into the hands of the Keepers of the Liberties of England, &c. within ≈øpecified, the manner within written, with the appurtenances, as within to me is commanded. And if it be with Inqui≈øition for the annual value, then thus is the Writ afore≈øaid returned.
The re≈øidue of the Execution of this Writ appears in a certain Inqui≈øition to this Writ annexed.
div.trailer: An Inqui≈øition indented taken at, &c. as the Inqui≈øition is before for the form, only putting in the new matter.

div.head: Return of the Writ of, who is Tenant out of the Exchequer.
div.p:
BY vertue of this Writ to me directed, to the Barons within written I certifie, that W.B. and M. his wi≈øe, are Tenants of the third part of the Mannor within written,
in three parts to be divided, and C.A.M.E. and I.B. the daughter of C.D. decea≈øed, are Tenants of the ≈ø econd part of the Mannor afore≈øaid, in three parts to be divided, and the third part of the Mannor afore≈øaid remains in the cu≈øtody of the Keepers of the Liberties of England, by rea≈øon of the Minority of P.B. ≈øon and heir of the afore≈øaid C.B.

M. of the aforenamed W.B. and his wife.
John Doo.
Rich. Roo.

div.head: Return of a Venirefac. out of the Exchequer, or Office of the Coron. in nature of Summons, where he is in≈øufficient,
div.p: The within named A.B. nothing hath in my Shire by which he may be attached, or where ≈øummon him I may.

The within named A.B. attached is by pledg. viz.
Io. Fen.

div.head: The I≈ø≈øues of the≈øe 1 Mark ‚Ä¢
div.p: And further, if the≈øe words be receited in the Writ, As al≈øo to ≈øhow, then in every one ten ≈øhillings.

div.head: Return of Di≈øtringas where part nothing has in the Land.
div.p: The within named A.B. nothing has in the Lands, Tenements, and Hereditaments within written, by which him di ≈øtrain I may:

div.head: Otherwi≈øe.
div.p: No ≈øuch mannor is there nor any Land or Tenement known by the name of E. lying in the County of S. upon which the Tenants thence di≈øtrain I may, as within to me is commanded.

div.head: Return of Venditioni Expo≈øita.
div.p: Kitch. Exponend.BY vertue of this Writ to me directed, from day to day to ≈øale have I expo ≈øed tho≈øe goods and Cattels to the value of C. s. re≈øid. of the 8. l. which lately of the goods and Chattels, Lands & Tenements of T.E. within named, I took, and thereupon ≈øold to the value of xl. s. which xl. s. at the day and place within contained, ready I have to render to the within named C.D. as within to me is commanded. And the re≈øidue of the goods and Chattels afore≈øaid yet in my hands remain un≈øold for default of buyers.

div.head: Otherwi≈øe of the return of vendition. Exponas.
div.p: TO the Barons within written I certifie, that tho≈øe C. ≈øheep in this Writ ≈øpecified to ≈øale expo≈øe I could not, becau≈øe that yet they remain in the hands of the within named R.N. lately Sheriff of the County of S. and never to me the afore≈øaid now Sheriff; yet by the afore≈øaid lately Sheriff delivered were.

div.head: Return of Fieri facias, wherein addition is given to the Defendant.
div.p: TO the Barons within written I certifie, that there are divers per ≈øons in my County of the name and ≈øirname of I K. viz. I.K. of B. I.K. of F. and I.K. of A. and that they are not contained in this Writ, of which afore≈øaid I.K. &c. his goods and Chattels the monies within ≈øpecified to levy I know not, therefore to the execution of this Writ proceed I could not.

div.head: Return of a Writ out of the Court of Wards and Liveries.
div.p: AFter the receit of this Writ, and before the return of the ≈ø ame, ≈øeverall ≈øummes of moneys within written paid were by ≈øeverall per≈øons within named, to the receiver of our Lord the King of his Court of Wards and Liveries, therefore to the execution of this Writ proceed I could not, as within to me is commaned.

div.head: The Return of a Significavit.
div.p: BY vertue of this Writ to me directed, I have taken the body of the within named A.B. who≈øe body remaines in the pri≈øon of the Keepers of the Liberties of England, &c. of the Ca≈øtle of Winch. under my ≈øafe cu≈øtody untill to holy Church as well for the contempt as wrong to it don, by him ≈øhall be ≈øatisfied, as this Writ exacts and requires.

div.head: The Return of a Signific. with Proclam.
div.p: THe within named A.B. is not found within my Shire, but by vertue of this Writ to me directed in my full County held at the Ca≈øtle of Winch, in the County within written the 15 day of July the yeare within written, publickly to be proclaimed I cau≈øed, that the afore≈øaid A.B. within ≈øix dayes after that proclamation his body render in form within written, as that Writ exacts and requires.

AN Inqui≈øition, &c. who ≈øay upon their Oath, that W.F. in the ≈øeedule to the Writ a ore≈øaid annexed named, is decea≈øed; but what day and year, or where, altogether they are ignorant of, and that W.M. al≈øo in the ≈øame ≈øcedule named, is re≈øident in London, and I.S. is Commorant at B. in the County of W. and A.R. in the town and County of Southampt. without the County of Southampt. and the other per ≈øons in the ≈øame ≈øcedule named, do ≈øo wander and remove up and down the County afore≈øaid; that taken or arre≈øted they cannot be. In te≈ø timony of which, &c.

South.AN Inqui≈øition, &c. who ≈øay on their Oath, that H.S. in the ≈ø cedule to this Writ annexed ≈øpecific, no others or more Mannors has in the County afore ≈øaid, be≈øides and above the Manor, Lands and Tenements in the ≈ø cedule to the Writ afore≈øaid annexed ≈øpecified, which extended, or into the hands of the Keepers of the Liberties of England,&c. ≈øei≈ø ed may be. In te≈øtimony of which, &c.

South.AN Inqui≈øition, &c. who ≈øay upon their Oath, that I.W. in the Writ afore≈øaid named, the day of the taking of this Inqui≈øition, was po≈ø≈ø e≈ø ≈øed of a certain demi≈øe for the term of twenty years of one me≈ø≈ø uage, &c. in A. in the County afore≈øaid, with the appurienances of the annuall value in all i≈ø≈øues over and above the repri≈øes of 4. l. which demi≈øe I the afore≈øaid Sheriff the day of the taking this inqui≈ø ition, took into the hands of the Keepers of the Liberties of England, &c. In te ≈øtimony of which, &c.

AN Inqui≈øition, &c. who ≈øay on their Oath, that a certain day and yeare the late Earle of H. died and where, altogether they are ignorant of, and that he no goods hath, or Chattels in the County afore≈øaid, which taken and into the hands of the ≈ø aid Keepers extended may be. And further they ≈øay, that the afore≈øaid Earle of H. the day in which he died, was ≈øei≈øed in his deme≈øme as of ≈øee, of and in
the Mannor of C. with the appurtenances of the clear annuall value in all i≈ø≈øues, over and above the repri≈øes of 25. l. which Mannor with the appurtenances before the comming of this Writ, I the afore≈øaid Sheriff by vertue of another Writ out of this Court i≈ø≈øuing, and of the part of the Remembrance of the ≈øaid Keepers of this Excheq. filed to be ≈øei≈ø ed have cau ≈øed into the hands of the ≈øaid Keepers by extent afore≈øaid. In te≈ø timony of which.

div.head: Otherwi≈øe.
div.p: THe Vicar. within written with the appurtetenances in the hands of the ≈øaid Keepers, is the Sea of the Bi≈øhop. of Winche≈øter, now being vacant.

div.head: Otherwi≈øe.
div.p: THat the Manors, Land & Tenements of the lately W. Lord of Ware, in the hands of the ≈ø aid Keepers are, becau≈øe T.W. Knight, now Lord of Ware, ≈øon and heire of the afore≈øaid W. has not ≈øued his livery out of the Court of the ≈øaid Keepers, &c. In te≈øtimony of which, &c.

div.head: The Return of a Writ of Partition.
div.p:
I R.O. E≈øq. Sher. of the County afore≈øaid, to the Ju≈øtices in the Writ to this ≈øcedule annexed, ≈øpec. Certifie, That by vertue of this Writ in my proper per≈øon, the fifteenth day of J. the yeare, &c. I came to the Me≈ø≈øuage in the writ afore≈ø aid, ≈øpec. and there by the oath of A.B, &c. (to the number of twelve) good and lawfull men of the County afore≈øaid, and of vi≈øne in the ≈ø ame Writ ≈øpec. (having re≈øpect to the
true value of the ≈øame me ≈ø≈øuage, the ≈øame me≈ø≈øuage with the appurtenances in foure equall parts to be parted I cau≈øed, and one part of tho≈øe parts, viz. &c. to be held to the ≈øame H.S. and his wife in the Writ afore≈øaid named in ≈øeverally by metes and bounds in the right of the ≈øaidI.E. Another part thence, viz. &c. to be held to I.C. and E. his wife in the Writ afore≈øaid named in ≈øeverally in the right of the ≈ø aid E. and two other parts thence, viz. &c. to be held to the afore≈øaid I.C. in ≈øeverally in his right proper. And I the afore≈øaid Sheriff, the day and yeare above ≈øaid tho≈øe to be delivered and a ≈ø≈øigned, have cau≈øed, as the ≈øame Writ exacts and requires.

div.head: The manner and form how to keep a Court Leet, or a Law-day with all things thereunto appertaining as followeth.
The third Book.

div.p: AltoÃÑ We≈øt brake.Fir≈øt the Steward mu≈øt make his precept to warn the Court thus.

I W.Gentleman Steward of R.T. Knight of his Mannor, or his hundred of A. to the Baily of the ≈ø ‚Ä¢ me Mannor greeting; I command thee that diligently warn thou do ‚Ä¢ t the Court, with view of Frankpledge of the Mannor afore≈øaid, to be held the 20. day of October next following, about the hour of nine, before noone of the ≈øame day, at the place accu≈øtomed; given under my ≈ø eal the twentieth day of September, the yeer, &c.
Then enter the Court.
SS. The view of Frankpledge, with the Court of T. Knight there held on Thur≈ø day, viz. the twentieth day of October, the yeer, &c.
Then cau≈øe the Bailiff to make three Proclamations, and ≈øay after the Steward thus.
div.q: All maner of per≈ø ons which are Re≈øiants or Dozoners, and owe ≈øuit Royal to this Court Leet or Law day, come in and do your ≈øuite, and an≈øwer to your names as you ≈øhall be called, every man at the fir≈øt call, upon pain and peril that ≈øhall fall thereon.
div.p: Then call the free ≈øuitors and dozoners one after another thus:
div.q: L.G. Gent. come into the Court and do your ≈øuit and ≈øervice, or el≈øe you will be amerced, and when you have called them, all tho≈øe which made default, mark them over the head thus, Laurente G. is a merced two pence, and when all the free ≈øuiters be called, you mu≈øt write thus, They are Freehorders of this mannor, and owe ≈øuit to this Court, and have made default, therefore every of them is amerced as it appears upon their heads.
div.p: Then the Steward mu≈øt cau ≈øe the Bailiffs to make three Proclamations, and then to ≈øay thus, And if any man will be E≈ø≈ø oined, let him come in and he ≈øhall be received, and all ≈øuch per≈øons as were E≈ø ≈øoined the la≈øt Court, let them come now in and warrant their E ≈ø≈ø oines, or el≈øe they will be amerced both for this Court, and al ≈øo for the la≈øt, that is, they mu≈øt appear, and not be again E≈ø≈ø oined; for if that be ≈øuffered, it will hinder the ≈øervice; And if any de≈øire to be E≈ø ≈øoined by their Tythingman or other ne ‚Ä¢ ghbour, then for the fir ≈øt Court they may be E≈ø≈øoined, and their E≈ø≈øoines mu≈øt be entred as they are in the hundred Court in this book.
Then let the Bailiff ≈øay after the Steward, if any man will enter any plaints, let them come forth and they ≈øhall be heard.
Then if any come to have any plaints entred, then enter them as they are entred in the hundred Courts, and if need be, tho≈øe declarations and pleadings will ≈øerve here.

Then call the Tythingman of every tything with his tything, and demand of him if his whole tything be there or no, and ask him what Law-day, or hundred ≈øilver he hath brought, this done, receive his money, and ≈øwear him thus.

div.head: The Tything-mans Oath.
div.p: YOu ≈øhall ≈øwear, that you ≈øhall make true inquiry, and the ≈øame pre≈ø ent of all ≈øuch Articles and things as ≈øhall be given you in charge, concerning the keepers of the Liberty of England, by the Authority of Parliament, and the Lord of this Leet or Law-day, wherein you ≈øhall no concealment make, you ≈ø hall ≈øpare nothing meet to be pre≈øented within your tything for love, favor, affection or corruption, neither ≈øhall you pre≈øent any thing for malice, hatred or envy, but according as the truth of things have, may or ≈øhall come to your knowledge, by information or otherwi≈øe: So ≈øhall you make thereof a true pre≈øentment without concealment, So help you God, &c.
Then call the whole tything by name and ≈øwear them thus.
div.q: The ≈øame Oath which A.B. your thythingman hath on his part taken before you and every of you, you ≈øhall for your parts ob≈øerve, perform, and keep in every Article and thing which ≈øhall be given you in charge at the Leet, ≈øo help yee God and the contents of this Book.
div.p: Then call the Con≈øtables of the hundred if there be any there, and ≈øwear them thus:

q.p: You ≈øhall ≈øwear, that you ≈øhall make due inquiry, and the ≈ø ame pre≈øent of all ≈øuch Articles and things as ≈øhall be given you in charge, and of all and every ≈øuch thing and things, which are, ≈ø hall, or may come to your knowledge m ‚Ä¢ et to be pre≈øented at this Court concerning your office, wherein you ≈øhall ≈øpare no man for love, fear, favor, affection, or corruption, neither ≈øhall you pre≈øent any man for malice, hatred, or envy, ≈øo ≈øhall you make both a j ‚Ä¢ ≈øt and a true pre≈ø entment thereof without concealment, So help you God; and the contents of this Book.

In like manner you ≈øhall ≈øwear Ale-ta≈øters, Heywards,
and other officers, if any ≈øuch be an≈øwerable, or ought to appear there according to their particular offices.

div.p: Then call to the Bailiff for the names of the Jury, and bid him return them in writing, whereof mu≈øt be twenty four, which return made and delivered, bid the Bailiff make an O-yes and ≈øay after you thus:
div.q: You good men that be returned to inquire for the keepers of the Liberty of England, by Authority of Parliament, and the Lord of this Leet or Law-day, an≈øwer to your names, as you ≈øhall be called, every man at the fir≈øt call, upon pain of amerciament.
div.p: Then call the Jurors ≈ø everally by name as they be returned, and prick them openly which appear, and none el≈ø e, and when fourteen or fifteen, or more have appeared, then call the foreman to the Book, and ≈øwear him thus:

div.head: The foremans Oath.
div.p: YOu ≈øhall duly inquire, and true pre≈øentment make of all ≈øuch Articles and things as ≈øhall be given you in charge, the keepers of the Liberty of England, by Authority of Parliament councel, your fellows, and your own you ≈øhall well and truly keep, and not di≈øclo ≈øe the ≈øame, but here in Court you ≈øhall pre ≈øent the truth, and nothing but the truth, ≈øo help ye God and the contents of this Book; and then let him ki≈øs the Book to affirm his Oath.
Then call the re≈øt of the Jury by three or four at once, and ≈øwear them thus:

Al≈øo ≈øuch oath as A.B. your foreman hath taken before you on his part, you and every one of you ≈ø hall well and truly ob≈øerve and keep on your part, ≈øo God yee help, and the contents of this Book.

And note that the Steward may impannel any ≈øtranger, if there want to make twelve of the Jury, becau≈øe it is for the ≈øervice of the keepers of the Liberty of England by
Authority of Parliament for a pre≈øentment made by fewer then by twelve is traver≈øable.

list.item: Jo. Doe. Jur.
